intro: Hieracium malacodes, commonly known as the black knapweed, is a species of flowering plant in the family Asteraceae. It is native to Europe and parts of western Asia, typically found in meadows, grasslands, and disturbed soils. The plant has dark green, heart-shaped leaves and produces small, dark purple to black flowers arranged in a composite head. It is characterized by its hairy stems and is often found in sunny, open habitats. Hieracium malacodes is a perennial herb that can spread through both seeds and rhizomes.
